description: Understanding the menstrual cycle is crucial for anyone who menstruates. It's a key indicator of overall health, and managing it properly contributes to well-being.
sentences: A typical menstrual cycle lasts 21 to 35 days.
Tracking your cycle can help you understand your body's patterns and identify irregularities.
Period pain (dysmenorrhea) is common, but severe pain should be discussed with a doctor.
Hormonal fluctuations during the cycle can affect mood, energy levels, and physical symptoms.
There is a wide range of menstrual products available, from pads and tampons to cups and discs.
dos: Track your cycle to monitor your health.
Maintain good hygiene during your period.
Eat a balanced diet and stay hydrated.
Consult a gynecologist for any concerns or severe symptoms.
donts: Don't ignore irregular periods or excessive pain.
Don't feel ashamed or embarrassed about menstruation.
Avoid using scented products that can cause irritation.
Don't use a tampon or menstrual cup for longer than the recommended time.
